newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan overnight rates steady at 20 percent.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan overnight rates steady at 20 percent.

text.p: Pakistan's money rates stayed high on Sunday amid a shortage of liquidity and dealers said rates were likely to open at similar levels on Monday.
"Overnight money market maintained yesterday's level of 20 percent," dealer Imran Ahad at Standard Chartered Bank said.
He said banks discounted about 13 billion rupees with the State (central) Bank of Pakistan.

A dealer at KASB & Co said the central bank aimed to sell four billion rupees of short-term federal bonds at an auction set to match an inflow of 4.091 billion rupees on maturity of bonds auctioned earlier. -- Ovais Subhani 9221-5685192
